abstract.p: Monica Seles beats Dominique Van Roost in semifinals of Pilot Pen tennis tournament (M)

block.p: Monica Seles cruised to the semifinals of the Pilot Pen tournament in New Haven yesterday by defeating Dominique Van Roost of Belgium, 6-1, 6-2.

Their match was one of two completed as rain delayed much of the day session. Patty Schnyder ousted Yelena Dementieva of Russia, 1-6, 7-5, 6-3. Schnyder will play top-seeded Venus Williams, the defending champion, in the semifinals tomorrow.
Monica Seles cruised to the semifinals of the Pilot Pen tournament in New Haven yesterday by defeating Dominique Van Roost of Belgium, 6-1, 6-2.

Their match was one of two completed as rain delayed much of the day session. Patty Schnyder ousted Yelena Dementieva of Russia, 1-6, 7-5, 6-3. Schnyder will play top-seeded Venus Williams, the defending champion, in the semifinals tomorrow.

Aware that Van Roost's backhand is her best weapon, Seles focused on her forehand and elicited more than a dozen errors off that side. At one stretch in the 55-minute match, Seles won 10 of 11 games. After Van Roost saved a match point at 1-5 in the second set, Seles closed out the match with a 105-mile-an-hour service winner.
